data.title: Provo's got a new Cone King!
data.text: This is the new favorite hangout for ice cream snobs!  There are no gimmicks or weight machines here.  Just the very best tasting ice cream anywhere.  Forget wasting money on premium brands in the freezer section of the grocery store or the freeze dried versions that mock quality and leave you listless.  This is just knock-your-socks-off superior ice cream served in an impressive array of cups and cones!

data.title: Authentic Ice Cream!
data.text: If you love thick creamy ice cream, this is the place for you. They have a nice variety and it's all delicious. I had cookies n cream and the snickerdoodle and it was fab.

data.title: Just Amazing Ice Cream!!
data.text:
My son took us to this Ice Cream place, it has become his go to place on dates. It is in a good location at the corner of Center and University Avenue and the Ice cream is wonderful. I am usually a Baskin and Robbins guy but if I am in Provo...Here I come to Rockwells. 

I got 2 scoops, which BTW was hugh and way too much($6) I got the Honeycomb Ice Cream (based off the chocolate not out of the bee hive), and Biscotti (the cookie). TO DIE FOR!! My wife raved over their Salted Carmel. My son always gets Strawberry. tastes so fresh. 

I will be back...many times.

data.title: OMG -- Best Ice Cream Ever!
data.text: Rockwell just opened earlier this year, but it is a fabulous addition to Downtown Provo. The owner makes GENIUS combinations -- although my standing favorite is Bischoff (like the airline cookies), which was delish in a Salted Pretzel Ice Cream Cone!  I've even tried the Basil Ice Cream, which tastes much better than it sounds -- but he has won my heart with the Bischoff. Long lines on hot summer evenings, but totally worth it!

data.title: Not what we were expecting
data.text: I give this joint thumbs way down. Disappointing on almost all counts. Small and overflowing Styrofoam bowls for Sundaes? Outrageous prices? Flavorless hot fudge? No complimentary water but warm bottled water for $? Non-existent friendly service and long-haired workers with no tiebacks serving ice cream? Ew!! Employees standing around chatting and texting and not cleaning spills in the dining area? Sure, Rockwell has decent flavors of ice cream but were all out of Vanilla (what?) that we didn't even end up finishing but we'll take high-quality and friendly Leatherby's Creamery any day of the week. They've got it right for decades now.

data.title: Yummy Ice Cream
data.text: The ice cream is really good, made with fresh ingredients.  Creamy good.  they also have specialty cones, like pretzel, chocolate chip,oreo, and waffle along with the more common sugar cone. I had the pretzel cone, it was a little thick and a little hard to eat.  Unfortunately, the evening I was there, it was quiet hot and their ice cream was sort of soft, so it made it messy to eat, but it was really good.

data.title: Great Ice Cream!
data.text: My wife and I have been here a couple of times.  She has fallen in love with the Salt Caramel Ice cream.  The quality of the ice cream is excellent.  Personally I think it is a bit pricey for what you get but the ice cream is really good.  Just be prepared for a bit of a sticker shock if you go but it is definitely worth the splurge from time to time:)

data.title: Not worth the $$$
data.text: We've been here twice. Once to try the baked goods and once to try the ice cream. Both time we were underwhelmed by the desserts and unhappy with the price. Yes, the single scoop is large, but I prefer quality over quantity. I got strawberry ice cream while my husband ordered chocolate chip cookie dough and we both said we wouldn't come here for ice cream again. As for baked goods, we had ordered a mini cheesecake, eclair, and fruit tart, and again were disappointed. There are much tastier dessert places in Provo.

data.title: Buenos helados
data.text: Buenos helados se pueden tomar en Rockwell Ice Cream, muy buena variedad de sabores y muy bien servidos.
